'''''Cactus Choir''''' is the first solo album by British keyboardist [[Dave Greenslade]], released in 1976 soon after the disbandment of his own eponymous band, [[Greenslade]].<ref name="allmusic" /> His Greenslade bandmate [[Tony Reeves]] also plays on half of the album's tracks. The artwork for the cover is by [[Roger Dean (artist)|Roger Dean]].

==Track listing==
All music written by Dave Greenslade. Lyrics written by [[Jon Hiseman]] (2) and Martin Hall (4, 6b).

;Side one
#"Pedro's Party" - 2:38
#"Gettysburg" - 3:58
#"Swings and Roundabouts" - 4:19
#"Time Takes My Time" - 6:00
#"Forever and Ever" - 4:06

;Side two
#<li value=6>"Cactus Choir" - 6:15
::a)"The Rider" - 2:52
::b)"Greeley and the Rest" - 2:01
::c)"March at Sunset" - 1:22
#<li value=7>"Country Dance" - 5:36
#"Finale" - 8:37
 	
;2014 reissue bonus track
#<li value=9> "Gangsters" - 2:56

==Personnel==
<!--Details taken from cover of original LP release. The CD re-release omits several credits.--->
* [[Dave Greenslade]] — keyboards, lead vocal (4), vibraphone (5, 6, 8), handclaps (1), percussion (3), co-producer
* [[Tony Reeves]] — bass guitar (1, 2, 6, 8)
* [[Simon Phillips (drummer)|Simon Phillips]] — drums, percussion (1, 3)
* [[Steve Gould (musician)|Steve Gould]] — lead and backing vocals (2, 6)
* Dave Markee — bass guitar (3, 4), percussion (3)
* [[John G. Perry]] — bass guitar (7)
* [[Mick Grabham]] — guitar (4)
* Lissa Gray — backing vocal (4)
* [[Bill Jackman]] — bass flute (8), bass clarinet (8)
* Gregg Jackman — co-producer, engineer, handclaps (1)
* [[Rupert Hine]] — co-producer, handclaps (1)
* [[Chris Tsangarides]], Martin Moss - assistant engineers
* Simon Jeffes — orchestra arranger
* Martin Ford — orchestra conductor

{{Short description|American country music group}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Cactus Choir | image = | caption = | image_size = | alias = | origin = [[San Francisco|San Francisco, California]], United States | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | years_active = 1997–1998 | label = [[Curb Records|Curb]]/[[Universal Records|Universal]] | associated_acts = | website = | current_members = | past_members = Marty Atkinson
Gary Hooker
Dave Ristrim
Tim Hensley
Shane Hicks
Cal Ball
Eric Nelson }} '''Cactus Choir''' was an American [[country music]] group from [[San Francisco|San Francisco, California]], composed of Marty Atkinson (vocals), Gary Hooker (guitar), Dave Ristrim (steel guitar), Tim Hensley (banjo), Shane Hicks (keyboards), Cal Ball (bass) and Eric Nelson (drums).{{cite book|last=Whitburn|first=Joel|title=Hot Country Songs 1944 to 2008|publisher=Record Research, Inc|page=74|year=2008|isbn=978-0-89820-177-2}} The group's self-titled debut album was released by [[Curb Records|Curb]]/[[Universal Records|Universal]] on March 24, 1998.{{cite news|last=Price|first=Deborah Evans|title=Cactus Choir Thrives In The Studio|url=http://www.americanradiohistory.com/Archive-Billboard/90s/1998/BB-1998-02-07.pdf|accessdate=April 11, 2015|newspaper=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=February 7, 1998}} Jesse Mullins of ''American Cowboy'' gave the album a favorable review, writing that the musicians "come from varied musical backgrounds but have blended their talents well." Mullins compared their "wistful harmonies" to [[Restless Heart]] and [[Blackhawk (band)|Blackhawk]].{{cite news|last1=Mullins|first1=Jesse|title=Reviews|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=yuoCAAAAMBAJ&q=%22Cactus%20choir%22&pg=PA84|accessdate=April 11, 2015|work=American Cowboy|date=July–August 1998}} The group's first single, "Step Right Up", was released on December 9, 1997.{{cite web|title=Step Right Up – Cactus Choir|url={{Allmusic|class=album|id=mw0001008106|pure_url=yes}}|work=[[AllMusic]]|accessdate=April 11, 2015}} It peaked at number 62 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Hot Country Songs|Hot Country Singles & Tracks]] chart. A music video for the song aired on [[CMT (U.S. TV channel)|CMT]]. In 2011, Atkinson formed the duo Blue Cactus Choir with Katy Boyd.{{cite news|last1=Puccl|first1=Mark|title=Marty Atkinson & Katy Boyd Join to Form Blue Cactus Choir|url=http://www.gratefulweb.com/articles/marty-atkinson-katy-boyd-join-form-blue-cactus-choir|accessdate=April 11, 2015|work=Grateful Web|date=June 12, 2012}} ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! style="width:8em;"| Title ! style="width:18em;"| Album details |- ! scope="row"| ''Cactus Choir'' | * Release date: March 24, 1998 * Label: [[Curb Records|Curb]]/[[Universal Records|Universal]] |} ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2" style="width:10em;"| Single !
